description: Also known as the Mexican Red-headed Parrot, this is a medium-sized green parrot with a bright red patch on its forehead and a splash of violet-blue behind the eyes.
temperament: Energetic, playful, and intelligent. They are known to be quite charismatic but can be nippy and require good socialization.
loudness: Loud. They have a high-pitched, loud call.
vocalization: Fair to good talkers. They can learn a number of phrases but may not have the clarity of other Amazons.
dietaryNeeds: A balanced diet of pellets, fresh vegetables, and some fruits. Like other Amazons, they can become overweight if their diet is too high in fat.
healthPointers: Can live up to 50 years. Can be prone to psittacosis, fatty liver disease, and Pacheco's disease.
housing: Requires a spacious cage. Minimum size of 30"W x 24"D x 48"H. Their noise level makes them a challenge for apartment living.
